CatDescriptText: Helen Czarnecky, elevator operator, Carnegie and Henrietta Terry, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 9, 1960, pg. 29 with question "Do you believe the moral standards of our community have deteriorated since World War II?"  Ms. Czarnecky's answer reads: "Worse and mainly because the kids are having a too-easy life."  Ms. Terry's answer reads: "Worse and because people don't seem to be able to agree on anything."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Helen Czarnecky wearing necklace, belted dress, and dark coat, standing with hands in pockets in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Henrietta Terry wearing light colored blouse and dark gloves, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
